I'm trying to install py-iminuit, which I'm working on a package for, but it fails with the following error:

```
TEST FAILED: /blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-iminuit-1.2-cp2mvhi2hmkxxya5hhmq3plzkoar6c7r/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ does NOT support .pth files
error: bad install directory or PYTHONPATH

You are attempting to install a package to a directory that is not
on PYTHONPATH and which Python does not read ".pth" files from.  The
installation directory you specified (via --install-dir, --prefix, or
the distutils default setting) was:

    /blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-iminuit-1.2-cp2mvhi2hmkxxya5hhmq3plzkoar6c7r/lib/python2.7/site-packages/

and your PYTHONPATH environment variable currently contains:

    '/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-cython-0.23.5-cpnjauarbt4asqv2jixnbhoaxzxtqnze/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-matplotlib-1.4.3-m7w7su6vlayokqgzj7tmadxrn3omyzqg/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-dateutil-2.5.2-tnhd7ke3wntxskmyqnhzuoshaef5xqtq/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-setuptools-20.7.0-ximunmokiogzszdg2xl6azd67g4x6ooh/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-six-1.10.0-mnj5r5qtaoaql64weituixzpnwkdq4qj/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-funcsigs-0.4-wiiyrkibhhk7mbopqy2bt4gzzmaccq2x/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-mock-1.3.0-kpfgtcedqyuu5b4t5dm6lr7eyabuymc2/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-pbr-1.8.1-q23eqxzg2kle6pzev7dj6ujmbusnupvw/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-nose-1.3.7-vm457qch3abnvhy76wc4a6eltoswbiph/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-numpy-1.11.0-tduopn7ynp5tmzljhqy7ncgjxtfc4zau/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-pyparsing-2.0.3-a6kohzoukgxopv57e5t53ejz3ifkhk74/lib/python2.7/site-packages:/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/py-pytz-2016.3-npnc3eug3zky2j6skgjg4xizkanijpfn/lib/python2.7/site-packages'

Here are some of your options for correcting the problem:

* You can choose a different installation directory, i.e., one that is
  on PYTHONPATH or supports .pth files

* You can add the installation directory to the PYTHONPATH environment
  variable.  (It must then also be on PYTHONPATH whenever you run
  Python and want to use the package(s) you are installing.)

* You can set up the installation directory to support ".pth" files by
  using one of the approaches described here:

  https://pythonhosted.org/setuptools/easy_install.html#custom-installation-locations

Please make the appropriate changes for your system and try again.
```

It seems that we need to add the installation directory to PYTHONPATH before installation. I could hack it for this package pretty easily, but is there a way to do this for all Python modules?
title: PYTHONPATH must include installation directory
